name: loneal
text:
I'm not sure there's any way to do Watchmen justice in movie form. One of Watchmen's main deals is the fragmenting of time and perspective, and I just don't know how they're going to handle that in a movie unless they make it all postmodern-y, which wouldn't draw an audience.

Which is not to say I won't go see it on opening day.

name: norsef
text:
My biggest problem with it so far is how young and sleek everyone looks. For me it's already read like a band going through a midlife crisis and trying to regroup.
Rorschach is the unsuccessful solo artist slaving away in obscurity in the same old style.
Ozymandias is the Robbie Williams figure.
Nite Owl's the bassist who left for a lucrative job in a bank. Who still goes to his basement to rock out.
Silk Spectre II is the former roadie/dancer whose feeling slightly ashamed of her time with the band. Though she still loves that bassist.
Manhattan is the record company and the real power behind the band. Though now he's moved on and doesn't even want to know.

THAT's Zardoz. Oh, baby, the train wreck of train wrecks.

name: spinynorman
text:
I had some pretty rotten stuff back when I was twenty. It was one of the discoveries my buddy made as our unofficial scrounger %u2013 it was some horrible malt liquor made for %u201COktoberfest,%u201D but it had been made in Matamoros, Mexico. The label proudly proclaimed that it was called %u201CGermann Goodtimes%u201D and it had a picture of a donkey eating a lightbulb, and while I found this acceptable the labels seemed to come off pretty easily. I don%u2019t know why the idea of Mexico making an Ocktoberfest malt liquor was okay, especially when you think of how the thing had come out in summer, but my pal had managed to get them for %u201Calmost free,%u201D and after I had my first bottle I didn%u2019t go blind and the next bottle went down almost easier.

Later, when the girl I was partying with managed to get vomit everywhere BUT the toilet and I drunkenly neglected to clean it up, I decided that Rules Must Be Made in terms of drinking.

This did not last long.

name: spinynorman
text:
Okay, apparently Notepad and asset bar aren't pals, let me try that again here.

------------------

I had some pretty rotten stuff back when I was twenty. It was one of the discoveries my buddy made as our unofficial scrounger - it was some horrible malt liquor made for "Oktoberfest," but it had been made in Matamoros, Mexico. The label proudly proclaimed that it was called "Germann Goodtimes" and it had a picture of a donkey eating a lightbulb, and while I found this acceptable the labels seemed to come off pretty easily. I don't know why the idea of Mexico making an Ocktoberfest malt liquor was okay, especially when you think of how the thing had come out in summer, but my pal had managed to get them for "almost free," and after I had my first bottle I didn't go blind and the next bottle went down almost easier.

Later, when the girl I was partying with managed to get vomit everywhere BUT the toilet and I drunkenly neglected to clean it up, I decided that Rules Must Be Made in terms of drinking.

This did not last long.

name: arborwin
text: I never thought I'd see Utica mentioned here, of all places.

name: theargentinian
text: Midtown Detroit.

name: aikennubbles
text:
Good guesses all, but mostly wrong (half-credit for "circumstances"). The taquitos should have given you Southwestern U.S., and the artificiality of the microwave implies California. Kid Rock suggests Riverside, Barstow, or the San Joaquin Valley, and wife beaters, although abundant in Riverside, are more typical of the agrarian Valley and Barstow. The hint of baked body odor applies to both Bakersfield and Barstow, but (this is the tricky part) since I have a computer at all it's gotta be Bakersfield.

Now, if you figure out my final hint, you can come visit me: My keyboard has the faintest whisper of burning tire and lemons.

name: spinynorman
text: The real question isn't where you live but what the fuck you've been doing with that keyboard

name: daidai
text: I think the real question is whether it smells of burnt tires and burnt lemons -- or merely burnt tires and regular ol' lemons.

name: professorhazard
text: Wait a minute... this is all just a complex attempt to have people come visit you, so you can show them your He-Man fan fic where He-Man asks you how to become the master of Magic: The Gathering !

name: thorfinn
text: I was going to suggest Riverside, but didn't for fear of mockery.

name: thorfinn
text: Of course, the Riverside computer would have strong methamphetamine overtones to accompany the other scents.

name: doc_rostov
text: Combined with your avatar, this invitation to 'visit' you takes on a rather sinister air.

name: tekende
text: He would pay you at least a thousand dollars for this service.

name: spinynorman
text:
Are you like that lady who sat on a toilet for two years so that her buttocks actually grew around the seat, and now you're trying to manipulate someone into entering your abandoned home to free you from your porcelain ball and chain?

Because if so, I'll pass.

name: soupkaty
text:
oh god we were all titters and giggles in the newsroom when we found that on the wire.
oh ho, associated press.

name: opalleye
text:
I believe it was a couch.

Her name was Gail Grinds.

name: bixschmix
text: There is both a couch lady and a toilet lady. Both allowed their skin to fuse and grow around their particular home furnishing. I am ashamed at myself for knowing this and ashamed at America for producing these specimens.

name: thegoodwillgirl
text: Thank you so much for this toilet story. I immediately Googled it, and I continued on to email my findings to my entire family.

name: maximus
text: Behind the 7-11 on Wilson?

name: flazisismuss
text: Yech.  I weaseled out of having to go to Bakersfield recently.  Despite getting paid for it, I still dreaded the thought.  I was setting aside old shirts and suit coats that I wouldn't mind having to throw away for fear of having them smell like burning petroleum and cow shit.

name: tekende
text: When that city just has gas I change my shirt and run the garbage disposal.

name: bixschmix
text: I realized last week that I now feel better about being born in Bakersfield solely because that's where the GOF was held. I don't know if that's good or incredibly sad.

name: irondave
text: I have never been to Bakersfield, but I like Buck Owens and especially his famous song about Bakersfield.

name: loneal
text:
I stopped to fill up my gas tank in Bakersfield once.

BIG. MISTAKE.

name: tipist
text: Does "half-credit" mean you somehow gave me a half-chubby? Cuz that would put you on par with softcore porn viewed on "Skinemax", which also gives me a half-chubby.

name: flazisismuss
text: Fresno?

name: fireking
text:
The computer comes complete with a sample of Sean Connery's cologne.

Authentic!

name: catgrl131
text: Must...resist...chubbying...just...because...of...adorable...Hamtaro...avatar...

name: hatstand_mcq
text: I was once punished for smelling a pencil during a Latin class. The head boy summoned me to his study and told me that if I was ever again observed placing a freshly sharpened pencil within three inches of either nostril I would have my crumpet ration removed.

name: maximus
text:
Mr. Onstad's little trope makes me miss Edward Gorey:

To his clubfooted child said Lord Stipple,
As he poured his post-prandial tipple,
'You mother's behaviour
Gave pain to Our Saviour,
And that's why He made you a cripple.'

name: perilon
text:
Teodor knows the proper way to hold a fifty-pound box is by jamming your palms into the top corners and exerting great compressive force.

Cornelius knows the proper way to accept a fifty-pound box is by gently cupping your right elbow with your left, then politely shaking hands with one of the top corners. It is the decorous handshake of a gentleman meeting a bilious yet excitingly old-school boffin.

name: paperboy_2000
text:
With Teodor's posture I would be leery that the "package from England" might be similar to a Christmas Eve present from Justin Timberlake.

No, seriously, Cornelius. You need to stop describing the smell and just take the lid off the box. You - You're making this very awkward for both of us.

name: shades
text: If I was on a creative track that was leading me to use the phrase "smells like Sean Connery's neck at a wedding," I probably would have needed an extra day to make this strip too

name: higuma
text: A lot of those words and references were difficult for me to understand.

name: whiteturtle
text: I was going to make a comment on how that is understandable since you are a bear, but then I realized that Cornelius is also a bear, and the confounded logic stopped me in my tracks.  It did not stop me from being totally meta about it though.

name: comrade_tom
text: Don't be too hard on the bear, admitting you are a bear that needs help is half the battle.

name: mjfitzge
text: yeah, i'm not ashamed to admit that i busted out the dictionary for this strip.

name: steerpike66
text: Hands up who Youtubed the Ridley Scott Apple advert because they juuust couldn't remember it.

name: paperboy_2000
text: I was more concerned that Cornelius hadn't referred to Scott as 'Sir Ridley'.  But then, do you apply a title to the person when talking about works completed before the knighthood title was bestowed?  Then I figured Cornelius has more knowledge about proper use of British titles in his extended British pinkie-finger than I have in my doughy American body.

name: professorhazard
text: He didn't want us to think he was talking about the horrible space dragon from Metroid .

name: iseedeadpixels
text: I hate Ridley so fucking much

name: rowboat
text: Dude, I kicked that dragon's ASS! Then we all got girlfriends.

name: steerpike66
text: Life peerages. Discredited rubbish. they give the order of the garter to strippograms now.

name: saucy_jack
text: Weirdly, I just saw it yesterday and so remembered it very well.

name: straw
text: I'll always remember it because Futurama did a spoof on it.

name: talix18
text: No YouTube at work.  Very Minor Sad Thing.

name: johnnygeo
text: One man's preprandial is another man's antejentacular.

name: johnnygeo
text: dang it.  I thought that was postprandial.  That would have been a good epigram.

name: professorhazard
text: I feel that Cornelius prandializes the descriptions of far too many actions, and is bordering on the loquaciously blowhardy.

name: maximus
text: I think 'antejentacular' is perhaps the creepiest word in the English language

name: achilleselbow
text: I think something like "fistula" is worse.

name: whiteturtle
text: I've heard numerous reports that women dislike the words "moist" and "panties".

name: tekende
text: That's the first I've heard of women not liking the word panties. Moist I've heard about, so I make a point of using that word relatively often. I have a number of friends (of both genders) who hate the word moist.

name: loneal
text: I have also heard a lot of rancor directed toward "moist," and, to a lesser degree, "panties." I don't know why. I rather like both those words. The word "ointment" makes me feel icky, though, and it has that same "oi" sound as moist...maybe there's something about that sound.

name: tekende
text: I'm not a big fan of the word panties myself. It just sounds so...juvenile.

name: spinynorman
text: You know what word's fucking awkward? "Awkward." If there was a sound made by a gangly, uncoordinated, and strange way a 16 year old boy runs, "awkward" would be the onomatopoeia for that sound.

name: tekende
text: I love the word awkward.

name: loneal
text: Which is why it is probably the crowning achievement of the English language's vocabulary.

name: peterjoel
text: Whenever I see ads for WKD, I read it as "awkward" and never the intended "wicked". Perhaps this is why I would never purchase and consume it. Actually that isn't the reason.

name: loneal
text: It is kind of juvenile, but also kind of cute. I also really like the phrase "smarty-panties" instead of "smarty-pants," for a girl, or, conceivably, a dude who is into lingerie.

name: pogo
text: Moist panties are a good thing.

name: peterjoel
text: No, that must really chafe... unless.. unless you are lowering the tone...

name: straw
text: I read chafe as if it rhymed with cafe.  Clearly I must drink more.

name: daidai
text:
Your justifications for drinking are flawed.

Not that there should necessarily be stricter justifications, yours are merely flawed.

name: straw
text:
One man's flaw is another's perfection.

Of course, this is coming from a guy who digs girls with glasses, so take from it what you will.

name: opalleye
text: It smacks of cockney and should raise fear in the hearts of all red-blooded Americans who supported the Revolution.

name: thorfinn
text: Women don't mind either of the two words when used independently, but sometimes disapprove when you use both together

name: spinynorman
text: Mantypoist.

name: boredom_man
text: I'm pretty sure I'm that right now.

name: pogo
text: You mean "awkward panties"?

name: whiteturtle
text: Ok, now that is a great band name.

name: pogo
text: Tru dat.  A girl band, right?  Their first CD could be "Undies in a Bundle."

name: spinynorman
text:
"Bundy's Undies."

Could wind up being pretty morbid shit, though.

name: woodenteeth
text: Pawkward Anties: n. A small group of islands in French Polynesia inhabited entirely by cross dressing, gangly teenagers who wear lingerie as head dress.

name: straw
text:
Your above comment ("I enjoyed the delightful explanation of your own joke. Normally that does not go so well. Your happiness is infectious! What joy!") made me want to give you a chubby, but I was out. And yet, as my cursor hovered over the reply link, I somehow decided it did not warrant a virtual chubby. This comment, however, does.

Virtual chubby for you, good sir.

name: usversusthem
text: Woodenteeth, do you ever play Balderdash? Just... just curious.

name: saucy_jack
text: This is a good thing to have said, Pogo.

name: pogo
text: Thanks.  Got a spare chubby on ya?  I'm running a 2-1 deficit.

name: saucy_jack
text: I haven't had a chubby since the Great War.

name: rene
text: And also "loins" and "ointment."

name: catgrl131
text: Lointment?

name: rene
text: ew......I feel violated, just a little, when i read that word.

name: nickgranger
text: Sean Connery's Neck at a Wedding. New band name.

name: professorhazard
text: New cologne.

name: achilleselbow
text: New women's shampoo .

name: whiteturtle
text: New place to hide my face and cry as I realize our little girl is not a little girl any more.

name: achilleselbow
text:
Eh, I should've done this yesterday, but what the hell, might as well:

[IMGS OFF]

Oh to be like the cool kids and have/know how to use Photoshop.

name: sncether
text:
If you rinse and repeat four times before you condition, you end up with an awesome Hugh Grant-style coiffure.

hey everybody it's me, jay leno! anybody here like motorcycles?

name: i_love_kate
text: my droogs

name: i_love_kate
text:
Oh, for the love of...!

MAW! IT HAPPENED AG'IN!

name: yearsinhotclaws
text: Man, as long as you have that avatar, you can do no wrong in my eyes.

name: redmange
text: It is hard to tell by the tone of this strip whether Cornelius is being sincere about his excitement over Teodor's tomfoolery, or if he is setting up a very long winded -Fuck Along Now-.

name: abj
text: I love this strip for Cornelius's sense of advertising, and also the detailed scent analysis concluding "Yes, this is indeed British".

name: gilganixon
text: A comment left by gilganixon was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, tekende, speccer, Thorfinn, mortshire, mrblank91, scraggg, foea, Tipist)

name: whiteturtle
text: Belle looks a little...indisposed there.

name: tekende
text: Well. Imagine how big the Beast might be.

name: spinynorman
text: Way to go , Ron Perlman!

name: i_love_kate
text: People need to stop laming that post, deserving of it though it may be, simply so that others can understand that exchange in its entirety.

name: professorhazard
text: Anyone can see any obscured post by clicking on the clickable part of it that remains after it is gone.

name: whiteturtle
text: Our memories of those that die are like the clickable part of them that remains after they are gone.

name: maximus
tekende
text: I don't know, it might be funnier out of context.

name: deusoma
text: The shame in the fact that I fully understand that reference is countered by my belief that Ron Perlman is the greatest actor ever.

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
your avatar is zooming in perfect sync with my music.

that is all.

name: straw
text:
IT'S NEVER LUPUS

1 2 3 4

name: woodenteeth
text: Great now I can't get THAT image out of my head. All reaching around tightly squeezing his hand. I think porn has ruined me.

name: tekende
text: You're welcome.

name: daidai
text: I laughed, then said "ew"

name: peterjoel
text: Belle, are you crappin'?

name: whiteturtle
text: A chubby!  For you. Of the virtual sort.

name: hbaranov
text:
Just to whore the image I made for the previous comic. Cornelius operating system.
[IMGS OFF]

name: wittyname
text: A comment left by wittyname was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by chuchurocket, AgentJ, Tipist)

name: whiteturtle
text: I am not going to lame you, because that is a fair statement and I am sure other people are gonna jump on that wagon anyway, but I have to disagree.  Onstad manages to nail with pinpoint accuracy not just one but dozens of difficult to evoke sensations using two stuffed bears and a box with a crown on it.  That is very exciting to me.

name: wittyname
text:
This comic actually made me do something that has never happened to me whenever I read old one Achewood strips. I got up and walked away from the computer to do something else. I got up to panel three, and finished it later. And my opinion didn't change after finishing it.
I mean, damn . I looked at a wall of text and said, %u201CY%u2019know, I really don%u2019t want to read any of that. I think I%u2019ll play some video games.%u201D I know I didn%u2019t get the same reaction as many other people. People may accuse me of %u201Cnot getting it%u201D. But I don%u2019t remember what Cornelius said that doesn%u2019t come down to %u201CHow delightfully British I am, and so is this box. Huzzah!%u201D Not that I didn%u2019t understand it, but I read over it and I couldn%u2019t be bothered to care.
All the interesting plot lines that could have been followed up on -- Phillipe being left home alone, probably an explanation to the Prostitute Dreams and we get this?

name: wittyname
text: Oops.

name: tekende
text: The messed up apostrophes there actually made this post a lot more entertaining.

name: wittyname
text: It's like Assetbar pretty much took my rant and said "DISREGARD THAT, I SUCK COCKS"

name: usversusthem
text: I'm so sad to be out of chubbies right now, wittyname.

name: lonis
text: Got you covered.

name: spinynorman
text: It's like the worst secretary ever

name: rowboat
text: The kind that tells everyone that you're cheating.

name: synnah
text: That is about the only thing you can say after being raped so throughly by Assetbar.

name: comrade_tom
text: Assetbar rapes quickly and vigorously, ina simmilar manner to the way a south korean eats a pastrami sandwich.

name: opalleye
text: Unfounded racial stereotypes were soooo last week.

name: foea
text: Also, dragging out vowels to emphasize a word is outmoded.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: I didn%u2019t understand it

name: catgrl131
text: We did get an explanation: The Achewood machine was broken. Lyk, omg duh!

name: saucy_jack
text:
Similarly, when I got to the mess that is the last two thirds of your asset, I said, "You know, I really don't want to read any of that."

Assetbar makes fools of us all.

name: wittyname
text:
I guess I'll repost it, though the impact is certainly dulled.

"This comic actually made me do something that has never happened to me whenever I read old one Achewood strips. I got up and walked away from the computer to do something else. I got up to panel three, and finished it later. And my opinion didn't change after finishing it.

I mean, damn. I looked at a wall of text and said, "Y'know, I really don't want to read any of that. I think I'll play some video games." I know I didn't get the same reaction as many other people. People may accuse me of "not getting it". But I don't remember what Cornelius said that doesn't come down to "How delightfully British I am, and so is this box. Huzzah!" Not that I didn't understand it, but I read over it and I couldn't be bothered to care.

All the interesting plot lines that could have been followed up on -- Phillipe being left home alone, probably an explanation to the Prostitute Dreams and we get this?"

name: straw
text: Ah, to once again be 19, male...

name: wittyname
text: So the sex change went good then?

name: straw
text: No.

name: saucy_jack
text:
I quite agree with you. Although I enjoy the whole, "How delightfully British I am," thing, there's stuff I'd rather see from Achewood, and I think it's been done better by other sources (Stephen Fry).

I miss being in the middle of the archives, because you were never disappointed by an "eh" strip. You could just keep going until you got to a great one.

name: rowboat
text: I, for one, would never accuse you of %u201Cn%u201D.

name: phy
text: Strong, simple, elegant. Forged from fine ores, machined and polished to gleaming by honest men with honest moustaches, under a bright Newcastle sun. A sturdy new head for your trusted garden spade? Surely not: It is the Envaliant III, the newest "lap-top" computing engine, from the lads at Shrovis-Bishopthorpe.

name: tsume454
text: This is what it would sound like if Nice Pete got a job writing for PCWorld

name: neonfreon
text: A comment left by neonfreon was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, Thorfinn, re5urgam, Conn, atticusonline, explodingbat, SpinyNorman, foea)

name: agentj
text: the gestalt of the whole not unlike

name: eatmorekix
text: "gestalt of the whole" is sort of awkward and/or redundant, isn't it?

name: scraggg
text: That or the name of an ambient/drone album.

name: eatmorekix
text: oh god i gag when i see albums with names like that. sorry if that offends you somehow, as an obvious fan of a band with difficult album names.

name: scraggg
text: Ironically, as I read this, I was listening to an album entitled "Oh Me Oh My... The Way the Day Goes By the Sun Is Setting Dogs Are Dreaming Lovesongs of the Christmas Spirit".

name: eatmorekix
text: at least that one is easily abbreviated. tell me, as a GY!BE fan, how do you pronounce their first album? f-sharp a-sharp infinity? i always wonder stuff like that, like how the fuck do you pronounce the band name OOIOO. WHY BE SO DIFFICULT?

name: tekende
text: Or that band called !!! I mean, seriously. What the hey.

name: whiteturtle
text:
!!! is pronounced *Chik* *Chik* *Chik*.

Insert ubiquitous "the more you know" graphic here.

name: tekende
text:
I know, but I don't care. Exclamation points do not in themselves make a sound, therefore any pronunication, official or no, is inherently invalid.

This is the reason I do not listen to !!!. I don't care how good their music might be.

name: eatmorekix
text: it's not that good so don't worry.

name: richfamous
text: I pronounce that band's name by opening my eyes really wide.

name: straw
text:
Haha, o man. Virtual Chubby.

Also, while we're on the general topic, I thought that Khoisan languages (when written by white devils) are marked with ! whenever they have a click sound in their speech. Is this actual or am I just drunk?

name: divot
text: I have heard this too, but I am not sure as to its veracity.

name: straw
text: I have heard them back it up in such as a radio interview.

name: woodenteeth
text: !!! are incredibly fun live. Their albums are some of the most organic sounding dance music around. Their name can be pronounced with any three consecutive sounds that you feel fit (heard a couple of interviews confirming this). It is a marketing gimic, nothing more.

name: saucy_jack
text: I fail on pronouncing them even with such leniency. If I am listening to !!! and someone asks, I shout incoherently and look surprised.

name: whiteturtle
text:
You're a naughty one, Saucy Jack.
You're a haughty one, Saucy Jack.

You know, I really envy us.

name: saucy_jack
text:
YES!

I'd give you a chubby but I'm all out.

name: bixschmix
text: I'm sorry, I made this point a few posts above. If I were not silly, I would have scrolled down to see that you beat me to it, 15 hours ago.

name: spinynorman
text:
Having grown up on Dave Barry, most of my time is spent pointing out various non sequitirs in conversations that would make hilarious band names. Memorable ones include "Soviet Dick," "Frank Capra's Shetland Pony Assholes," "Stinky Peete and the Chuckwagon Faggots," and "Fred Thompson's Horrible Genitals."

Now I can't remember any of the conversations from which those splinters of stupidity arose. Just useless band names. When I get old and senile and start spouting phrases from my youth, everyone at Luby's is going to be really disturbed by the old man shouting "CHUCKWAGON FAGGOTS! CHUCKWAGON FAGGOTS!"

name: straw
text: Just don't say it a third time or your case worker's gonna be pissed.

name: sncether
text:
What, are you afraid it's going to summon something, "Beetlejuice" style? A Conestoga wagon full of men in hot pants, perhaps? Serving tin plates of beans with rough-hewn wooden spoons?

I don't even know what Luby's is, but I can guarantee that would improve it.

name: tekende
text: Luby's is a cafeteria. It is mostly a dining place of old people.

name: loneal
text: Sounds...slippery.

name: straw
text: Frankly, I'm just so delighted you got the reference right off the bat.  Vchub.

name: soupkaty
text:
from what i've heard, you can say it with any three sounds repeated. chik chik chik is just the most popular.
i do not know this from fact, just something a lady told me once.

name: falseprophet
text:
Don't worry, I got it.

[IMGS OFF]

name: bixschmix
text: No. Sorry, incorrect. Technically, !!! can be pronounced any way you choose. I call them "pow pow pow." Chik chik chik has become accepted, but when they first came out I read an interview where they said that any three sounds, repeated, were correct and acceptable.

name: achilleselbow
text: I can go one better: I'm currently in the process of forming a band whose name consists of three soft signs .

name: brokeaccount
text: I know someone who makes music under the name of three tildes... I don't know why he chose that, but he did.

name: foea
text: Comes first in an alphabetical search?

name: saucy_jack
text: Count this comment as a chubby in your favor.

name: hamscout
text:
Quote:
"The lives 5,000 screaming fans were cut short today, as their favorite band (brainchild of achilleselbow) appeared on the Good Morning America stage in NY. Unfortunately, upon glimpsing the musicians, the fans simultaneously attempted to scream the band name, causing their soft paletes to fold in on themselves, forming a miniature black hole into which their bodies were slowly sucked.


"Yeah, I saw %u044C%u044C%u044C at the Garden last year, and they were...*gwrarflfft!*"

*chubby*

name: hamscout
text: spell check and assetbar can go  %u044C  themselves

name: straw
text: what

name: brokeaccount
text: You say it "oh oh eye oh oh".

name: jay-are
text: Officially, 'oh oh eye oh oh'. Takes some of the magic out of it, doesn't it?

name: daidai
text:
It made me think of salted whole milk.

Is that wrong?

name: comrade_tom
text: Dont hold a freshly sharpened pencil too close to your nose our neville lost an eye that way.

name: epicurus
text: I can actually imagine the smell of Sean Connery's neck at a wedding very clearly. That might be the best odour description I've ever seen to date.

name: tekende
text: I'm vigilantly trying to avoid it.

name: kylemcjuicy
text: This comic was worth the wait.

name: dino_grill
text: Hee Mr. Bear gives Halston a shout out.  Really is more of his time.

name: orf
text: I want to chubby the whole comment section today. You're killing me here. You guys are really hitting it out of the park.

name: straw
text: A two-fold chubby for you: one for the super-positive comment and one for llama.

name: i_love_kate
text: Hah. For a split second there I just thought you were being really self-complimentary.

name: straw
text: Well, from a metaphysical standpoint I probably was.

name: daidai
text:
I did too, and chubbied him for it.

It was a chubby given under false pretenses, but I want you to keep it.

name: straw
text: Hey man, thanks.  I will now peruse some of your other comments and dole out chubbies accordingly (this is my definition of a virtual chubby, but it may not be others').

name: maximus
text: That must be in a wooden crate packed with excelsior. Cornelius removes the laptop and, with an careworn rag, applies a stinting coat of S-B's Patented 3-in-1 Protective Oil.

name: worldbelow
text: I'm British... and this strip is incomprehensible .

name: rabbidpanda
text: In much the way that the dialect normally spoken by his American characters would be borderline incomprehensible to the average dude on the street.

name: pr0ncess
text:
I was just thinking recently about how we British keep quiet when Onstad unleashes his so-called "Anglophilia", and the people on Assetbar go all "woo hahahahaha British people/food/celebrities suck!!", and wondering whether we kept quiet for any of the following reasons (and this is a non-exhaustive list):

-- we silently agree with the American comments (I couldn't help but laugh when I read one comment about England's chavish population and its incapacity to formulate any form of intelligent riposte)
-- we know better than to join a debate on the INTERNET, ye home of AOL (remind me, does the A stand for... Anglophiles?)
-- we enjoy and laugh at the ragging they give us, safe in the knowledge of own superiority
-- we don't know what to say so we just keep mum and hope the next Showbiz strip comes soon to deflect attention from us

there are many other reasons but those are the ones that came to mind.

Also, why am I so exhausted that I cannot get up, but the moment I call and cancel my appointments for the morning, I am on the internet talking rubbish instead of sleeping. WRRRRRY.

name: loneal
text: Look, Americans need to believe there is someone out there more ridiculous than we are.

name: achilleselbow
text: Right, and the British provide the only safe target for ridicule. They're ethnically identical and our culture is just a cheap knockoff of theirs. It's like how no one would care if Pathmark put outrageous claims about Cocoa Krispies on boxes of Cocoa Krisp Rice.

name: straw
text: Jeez guy.

name: professorhazard
text: Someone's forgetting about the French!

name: achilleselbow
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: flazisismuss
text: American mocking of anglophilia is not the same as mocking the English. (Let's leave the Scots and Welsh out of this, they're entirely innocent.)  There is something more than faintly ridiculous about anyone in the US carrying on about and living in a world that is a fantasy of Victorian civility and mores... and this Victorian past was, by most accounts, a hellish nightmare of toil and disease.  American anglophilia has nothing to do with England or the English, and everything to do with our collective inability to grasp the horrible injustices of our own past or present.  Just my 2 cents.

name: pr0ncess
text: I chubby this comment.

name: irondave
text: We kid because we love.

name: brokeaccount
text:
I find it kind of charming that his insights into Britishness are filtered through such a north American lens.

He pulls off Cornelius's ex-pat thing pretty well, though. Or at least I assume that's his intent. Makes me wonder whether the US readers take that into account and don't just think of him as a wholly British character.

name: flazisismuss
text: He isn't an ex-pat at all.  He's a re-pat.  Brit Ex-pats, at least those in California, tend to be the happy hyperagressive car salesmen type, pleased as hell that everyone likes them for their charming accent.  They're happy about the good life and tend to  act more American than apple pie.  They deliberately keep the accent since it's a great meal ticket and are secretly afraid that we might wise up and realize that they're really a son of the working class.

name: brokeaccount
text:
If we're talking the actual definition of the term... Then yeah, he's an ex-pat. I think the difference between Cornelius and your experience with most British ex-pats is that Corneilus isn't a money-grubbing cunt. However he is Americanised in quite a lot of ways.

I've got to admit, Englishness is a really fun thing to play up in the US. Especially when female shop-assistants ask you to say specific words for them and then give you money off of stuff.

name: autrepoupee
text:
I think there are enough places Americans and non-Americans alike can go to make fun of America. Which is okay, sure. Making fun of Britain though, it's a bit rarer a commodity for most US citizens, at least. Humor aimed at the segments of America deemed backwards is pervasive, all over the place. It's refreshing to see another group get a little sassin'. Honestly, I think it's very cheap to make a joke about...the Southern United States or something. Just because I hear them all the time. I never hear, outside of Achewood, jokes aimed at Britain. It's probably different perspectives though. America-bashing jokes are old hat in America; British-bashing jokes are probably old hat in Britain.


also i mean seriously blood pudding

name: pr0ncess
text: I don't know who to reply to so I'll reply to myself... all I meant was, I was wondering, with amusement, as to why us British always keep very quiet during these strips... I was more probing for British comments than anything else. I'm not offended by the Brit-bashing, go for it. I'm hybrid British-French and I treat both my countries with equal disdain -- and of course get served for it on a regular basis.

name: baryonyx
text: Cornelius sure is perky lately.

name: spinynorman
text: he will soon be humming hell of ditties

text: A comment left by niggar was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by silver_lake, professorhazard, Thorfinn, snidedk, catgrl131, quaga, Darleen, GrooveHolmes, techiebabe, Doc_Rostov, ISeeDeadPixels)

name: tenthman
text: So you don't like the strip, that's fine, but you think Sabbath is something to laugh at?  Lame.

Messrs Cook and Moore.

just kidding it's awesome

you get a chubby you lucky bastard. but let's not forget - it's all about me and my special accomplishment.

name: falseprophet
text:
opprobrium, you just received a shout-out from Cornelius Bear, winner of the Bad-Ass Games, in the Achewood online comic strip!

What are you going to do next?

name: tupacodaman
text: panels 1 and 4 are the same except for teodor's eyebrows and the point at which the package is cut off from view

name: crunch-e-nuts
text:
Hi assetbars. Long time reader first time poster.
Is Cornelius being speaking literally in panel 3? i.e Teodor is Cornelius' son. Look alike, live together, ye olde names. I may have missed a strip where this was previously established or may just be missing my own father figure, sob.

name: whiteturtle
text: Do posters to this site have a general nomenclature yet? Because I think "assetbears" might be a good one, and I credit mr. crunch-e-nuts with it.  I am a proud assetbear.

name: sncether
text:
I believe your unconscious attributed an absent "E" (It would have been nice if it were an "A" to keep my alliteration going, but a las.)

Anyway, I think you can claim that credit, my friend. Perhaps you would like to exchange it at the assetbar gift shop for an oversize novelty comb? Or you can save up and go for the portable RCA black and white TV, for your kitchen table or boat, maybe.

name: whiteturtle
text: I turned it in and got a travel checkers set, but all the pieces looked like tiny candies, so I ate them.

name: sncether
text:
I can understand that. I probably would have stopped after the first one or two red ones, but good on you for keeping at it.

However, there's no excuse for eating the black ones. They clearly have all the hallmarks of black licorice (if you ignore that they're made of plastic and came with a tiny checker board) and there's no reason to put tooth to that, even experimentally.

name: achilleselbow
text:
I was going to say that it's an interesting theory, but they have entirely different last names (Cornelius Bear, and Teodor Orezscu) and Teodor is of Eastern European/Jewish origin. So barring an extremely convoluted story arc that explains all these things, not bloody likely.

Besides, they appear to be different kinds of bear.

name: miseryandthesun
text:
E-e-e-every rose has it's thorn

Just like every cowboy

sings a sad, sad song.

name: tekende
text: And every night has its dawn, but not every Assetbar post has an apparent reasoning behind it.

name: hypoluxa
text: Something I love about Cornelius is that he is capable of making me actually go look up the meaning of certain words.

name: johnmatrix
text:
"Smells like Sean Connery's neck at a wedding."

What does that mean? No, seriously, what could that possibly mean in any culture or language?
